scheduler

Class ICSEventBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.ICSEventBuilder

  • public class ICSEventBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Helps create a list of calendar events in ICS format.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marshal Brummel, Alan Sisouphone, Jake Walton

    • Method Detail

      • beginEvent

        public void beginEvent()
        Inserts the BEGIN statement of an event. All events must start with this.

      • endEvent

        public void endEvent()
        Inserts the BEGIN statement of an event. All events must end with this.

      • endCalendar

        public void endCalendar()
        Inserts the END statement for the calendar. The ICS calendar must end with this.

      • setDateStartEnd

        public void setDateStartEnd(java.lang.String startDate,
                            java.lang.String courseTime,
                            java.lang.String courseDays)
        Sets the start/end date and time of the event based on a course.
        Parameters:
        startDate - The starting date of a course
        courseTime - The start and end time of a course
        courseDays - The days the course is held on

      • setRule

        public void setRule(java.lang.String endDate,
                    java.lang.String courseDays)
        Sets the rules of the particular event based on the course. This allows for the repetition of an event/course
        Parameters:
        endDate - The last day of the semester
        courseDays - The days the course is held

      • setSummary

        public void setSummary(java.lang.String summary)
        Sets the summary of an event. This is the title of the event.
        Parameters:
        summary - The contents of the event summary/title

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String desc)
        Sets the description of an event. This is additional information for an event.
        Parameters:
        desc - The contents of the description for the event

      • toList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> toList()
        Makes an ArrayList of the ICS schedule contents.

        A list of the ICS schedule
